Package com.dua3.utility.fx.controls

Class CardPane

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
com.dua3.utility.fx.controls.CardPane
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class CardPane extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane
CardPane is a custom layout component that manages a collection of "cards" (Node elements) and allows switching between them by name. It utilizes a StackPane to display the cards, ensuring only the desired card is visible at a time.

    Methods inherited from interface javafx.css.Styleable

    getStyleableNode

  • Constructor Details

    • CardPane

      public CardPane()
      Constructs a new CardPane instance.

      Initializes the CardPane with a StackPane as its content container. The content pane is used to hold all child nodes (cards) and manages their visibility, ensuring only the intended card is shown at a time.

  • Method Details

    • addCard

      public void addCard(String name, javafx.scene.Node card)
      Adds a new card to the collection of cards managed by the CardPane. If a card with the specified name already exists, the method will throw an exception and no modification to the existing cards will occur.
      Parameters:
      name - the unique name to associate with the card being added
      card - the Node representing the card to add
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if a card with the specified name already exists

    • show

      public boolean show(String name)
      Displays the card associated with the specified name by bringing it to the front of the content container. If the card exists, it becomes the currently active card.
      Parameters:
      name - the unique name of the card to display
      Returns:
      true if the card with the specified name exists and is successfully shown, false otherwise

    • getCurrentCard

      public Optional<javafx.scene.Node> getCurrentCard()
      Returns the currently displayed card if one exists. The current card is the last node in the internal StackPane's children list.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the currently visible Node, or an empty Optional if no cards are present in the StackPane.

    • getCurrentCardName

      public Optional<String> getCurrentCardName()
      Retrieves the name of the currently displayed card, if one is present.
      Returns:
      an Optional<String> containing the name of the currently active card, or an empty Optional if no card is currently displayed.
